annotations.description: While processing a CredentialsRequest marked for deletion, the Cloud Credential Operator encountered an issue. Check the conditions of all CredentialsRequests with 'oc get credentialsrequest -A' to find any CredentialsRequest(s) with a .status.condition showing a condition type of CredentialsDeprovisionFailure set to True for more details on the issue.
annotations.message: CredentialsRequest(s) unable to be cleaned up
annotations.summary: One or more CredentialsRequest CRs are unable to be deleted.

annotations.description: The Cloud Credential Operator has determined that there are insufficient permissions to process one or more CredentialsRequest CRs. Check the conditions of all CredentialsRequests with 'oc get credentialsrequest -A' to find any CredentialsRequest(s) with a .status.condition showing a condition type of InsufficientCloudCreds set to True for more details.
annotations.message: Cluster's cloud credentials insufficient for minting or passthrough
annotations.summary: Problem with the available platform credentials.

annotations.description: While processing a CredentialsRequest, the Cloud Credential Operator encountered an issue. Check the conditions of all CredentialsRequets with 'oc get credentialsrequest -A' to find any CredentialsRequest(s) with a .stats.condition showing a condition type of CredentialsProvisionFailure set to True for more details on the issue.
annotations.message: CredentialsRequest(s) unable to be fulfilled
annotations.summary: One or more CredentialsRequest CRs are unable to be processed.

annotations.message: 1 or more credentials requests are stale and should be deleted. Check the status.conditions on CredentialsRequest CRs to identify the stale one(s).

annotations.description: At least one CredentialsRequest custom resource has specified in its .spec.secretRef.namespace field a namespace which does not presently exist. This means the Cloud Credential Operator in the openshift-cloud-credential-operator namespace cannot process the CredentialsRequest resource. Check the conditions of all CredentialsRequests with 'oc get credentialsrequest -A' to find any CredentialsRequest(s) with a .status.condition showing a condition type of MissingTargetNamespace set to True.
annotations.message: CredentialsRequest(s) pointing to non-existent namespace
annotations.summary: One ore more CredentialsRequest CRs are asking to save credentials to a non-existent namespace.

annotations.message: max pending CSRs threshold reached.

annotations.description: The Node Tuning Operator is degraded. Review the "node-tuning" ClusterOperator object for further details.
annotations.summary: The Node Tuning Operator is degraded.

annotations.description:
Pod {{ $labels.pod }} is not ready.
Review the "Event" objects in "openshift-cluster-node-tuning-operator" namespace for further details.
annotations.summary: Pod {{ $labels.pod }} is not ready.

annotations.message: Samples could not be deployed and the operator is degraded. Review the "openshift-samples" ClusterOperator object for further details.
Samples could not be deployed and the operator is degraded. Review the "openshift-samples" ClusterOperator object for further details.
Samples operator has been given an invalid configuration.
Samples operator has been given an invalid configuration.
Samples operator cannot find the samples pull secret in the openshift namespace.
The samples operator cannot find credentials for 'registry.redhat.io'. Many of the sample ImageStreams will fail to import unless the 'samplesRegistry' in the operator configuration is changed.

One of two situations has occurred.  Either
samples operator could not access 'registry.redhat.io' during its initial installation and it bootstrapped as removed.
If this is expected, and stems from installing in a restricted network environment, please note that if you
plan on mirroring images associated with sample imagestreams into a registry available in your restricted
network environment, and subsequently moving samples operator back to 'Managed' state, a list of the images
associated with each image stream tag from the samples catalog is
provided in the 'imagestreamtag-to-image' config map in the 'openshift-cluster-samples-operator' namespace to
assist the mirroring process.
Or, the use of allowed registries or blocked registries with global imagestream configuration will not allow
samples operator to create imagestreams using the default image registry 'registry.redhat.io'.

annotations.description: In most cases, you will still be able to apply patch releases. Reason {{ with $cluster_operator_conditions := "cluster_operator_conditions" | query}}{{range $value := .}}{{if and (eq (label "name" $value) "version") (eq (label "condition" $value) "Upgradeable") (eq (label "endpoint" $value) "metrics") (eq (value $value) 0.0) (ne (len (label "reason" $value)) 0) }}{{label "reason" $value}}.{{end}}{{end}}{{end}} For more information refer to 'oc adm upgrade'{{ with $console_url := "console_url" | query }}{{ if ne (len (label "url" (first $console_url ) ) ) 0}} or {{ label "url" (first $console_url ) }}/settings/cluster/{{ end }}{{ end }}.
annotations.summary: One or more cluster operators have been blocking minor version cluster upgrades for at least an hour.

annotations.description: The {{ $labels.name }} operator is degraded because {{ $labels.reason }}, and the components it manages may have reduced quality of service.  Cluster upgrades may not complete. For more information refer to 'oc get -o yaml clusteroperator {{ $labels.name }}'{{ with $console_url := "console_url" | query }}{{ if ne (len (label "url" (first $console_url ) ) ) 0}} or {{ label "url" (first $console_url ) }}/settings/cluster/{{ end }}{{ end }}.
annotations.summary: Cluster operator has been degraded for 30 minutes.

annotations.description: The image-registry operator is degraded because ImageRegistryCertificatesControllerError, and the components it manages may have reduced quality of service.  Cluster upgrades may not complete. For more information refer to 'oc get -o yaml clusteroperator image-registry' or https://console-openshift-console.apps.rhoms-4.9-021604.dev.openshiftappsvc.org/settings/cluster/.
annotations.summary: Cluster operator has been degraded for 30 minutes.

annotations.description: The openshift-samples operator is degraded because InvalidConfiguration, and the components it manages may have reduced quality of service.  Cluster upgrades may not complete. For more information refer to 'oc get -o yaml clusteroperator openshift-samples' or https://console-openshift-console.apps.rhoms-4.9-021604.dev.openshiftappsvc.org/settings/cluster/.
annotations.summary: Cluster operator has been degraded for 30 minutes.

annotations.description: The {{ $labels.name }} operator may be down or disabled, and the components it manages may be unavailable or degraded.  Cluster upgrades may not complete. For more information refer to 'oc get -o yaml clusteroperator {{ $labels.name }}'{{ with $console_url := "console_url" | query }}{{ if ne (len (label "url" (first $console_url ) ) ) 0}} or {{ label "url" (first $console_url ) }}/settings/cluster/{{ end }}{{ end }}.
annotations.summary: Cluster operator has not been available for 10 minutes.

annotations.description: The  {{ $labels.name }} operator behavior might cause upgrades to be unstable. For more information refer to 'oc get -o yaml clusteroperator {{ $labels.name }}'{{ with $console_url := "console_url" | query }}{{ if ne (len (label "url" (first $console_url ) ) ) 0}} or {{ label "url" (first $console_url ) }}/settings/cluster/{{ end }}{{ end }}.
annotations.summary: Cluster operator up status is changing often.

annotations.description: Failure to retrieve updates means that cluster administrators will need to monitor for available updates on their own or risk falling behind on security or other bugfixes. If the failure is expected, you can clear spec.channel in the ClusterVersion object to tell the cluster-version operator to not retrieve updates. Failure reason {{ with $cluster_operator_conditions := "cluster_operator_conditions" | query}}{{range $value := .}}{{if and (eq (label "name" $value) "version") (eq (label "condition" $value) "RetrievedUpdates") (eq (label "endpoint" $value) "metrics") (eq (value $value) 0.0)}}{{label "reason" $value}} {{end}}{{end}}{{end}}. {{ with $console_url := "console_url" | query }}{{ if ne (len (label "url" (first $console_url ) ) ) 0}} For more information refer to {{ label "url" (first $console_url ) }}/settings/cluster/.{{ end }}{{ end }}
annotations.summary: Cluster version operator has not retrieved updates in {{ $value | humanizeDuration }}.

annotations.description: Failure to retrieve updates means that cluster administrators will need to monitor for available updates on their own or risk falling behind on security or other bugfixes. If the failure is expected, you can clear spec.channel in the ClusterVersion object to tell the cluster-version operator to not retrieve updates. Failure reason VersionNotFound .  For more information refer to https://console-openshift-console.apps.rhoms-4.9-021604.dev.openshiftappsvc.org/settings/cluster/.
annotations.summary: Cluster version operator has not retrieved updates in 3h 46m 7s.

annotations.description: The operator may be down or disabled. The cluster will not be kept up to date and upgrades will not be possible. Inspect the openshift-cluster-version namespace for events or changes to the cluster-version-operator deployment or pods to diagnose and repair. {{ with $console_url := "console_url" | query }}{{ if ne (len (label "url" (first $console_url ) ) ) 0}} For more information refer to {{ label "url" (first $console_url ) }}/k8s/cluster/projects/openshift-cluster-version.{{ end }}{{ end }}
annotations.summary: Cluster version operator has disappeared from Prometheus target discovery.

annotations.description: For more information refer to 'oc adm upgrade'{{ with $console_url := "console_url" | query }}{{ if ne (len (label "url" (first $console_url ) ) ) 0}} or {{ label "url" (first $console_url ) }}/settings/cluster/{{ end }}{{ end }}.
annotations.summary: Your upstream update recommendation service recommends you update your cluster.

annotations.description: CoreDNS is returning SERVFAIL for {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} of requests.
annotations.summary: CoreDNS serverfail

annotations.description: CoreDNS Health Checks are slowing down (instance {{ $labels.instance }})
annotations.summary: CoreDNS health checks

annotations.description: {{ $value }} CoreDNS panics observed on {{ $labels.instance }}
annotations.summary: CoreDNS panic

annotations.description: etcd cluster "{{ $labels.job }}": database size exceeds the defined quota on etcd instance {{ $labels.instance }}, please defrag or increase the quota as the writes to etcd will be disabled when it is full.

etcd cluster "{{ $labels.job }}": Observed surge in etcd writes leading to 50% increase in database size over the past four hours on etcd instance {{ $labels.instance }}, please check as it might be disruptive.
etcd cluster "{{ $labels.job }}": 99th percentile of gRPC requests is {{ $value }}s on etcd instance {{ $labels.instance }}.
annotations.summary: etcd grpc requests are slow

annotations.description: etcd cluster "{{ $labels.job }}": 99th percentile commit durations {{ $value }}s on etcd instance {{ $labels.instance }}.
annotations.summary: etcd cluster 99th percentile commit durations are too high.

annotations.description: etcd cluster "{{ $labels.job }}": 99th percentile fsync durations are {{ $value }}s on etcd instance {{ $labels.instance }}.
etcd cluster "{{ $labels.job }}": 99th percentile fsync durations are {{ $value }}s on etcd instance {{ $labels.instance }}.
annotations.summary: etcd cluster 99th percentile fsync durations are too high.

annotations.description: etcd cluster "{{ $labels.job }}": {{ $value }} proposal failures within the last 30 minutes on etcd instance {{ $labels.instance }}.
annotations.summary: etcd cluster has high number of proposal failures.

annotations.description: etcd cluster "{{ $labels.job }}": member communication with {{ $labels.To }} is taking {{ $value }}s on etcd instance {{ $labels.instance }}.
annotations.summary: etcd cluster member communication is slow.

rules.name: etcdMembersDown
rules.query: max without(endpoint) (sum without(instance) (up{job=~".*etcd.*"} == bool 0) or count without(To) (sum without(instance) (rate(etcd_network_peer_sent_failures_total{job=~".*etcd.*"}[2m])) > 0.01)) > 0

annotations.description: etcd cluster "{{ $labels.job }}": members are down ({{ $value }}).
annotations.summary: etcd cluster members are down.

annotations.description: etcd cluster "{{ $labels.job }}": member {{ $labels.instance }} has no leader.
annotations.summary: etcd cluster has no leader.

annotations.description: etcd cluster "{{ $labels.job }}": {{ $value }} leader changes within the last 15 minutes. Frequent elections may be a sign of insufficient resources, high network latency, or disruptions by other components and should be investigated.
annotations.summary: etcd cluster has high number of leader changes.

rules.name: etcdInsufficientMembers
rules.query: sum without(instance, pod) (up{job="etcd"} == bool 1 and etcd_server_has_leader{job="etcd"} == bool 1) < ((count without(instance, pod) (up{job="etcd"}) + 1) / 2)

annotations.description: etcd is reporting fewer instances are available than are needed ({{ $value }}). When etcd does not have a majority of instances available the Kubernetes and OpenShift APIs will reject read and write requests and operations that preserve the health of workloads cannot be performed. This can occur when multiple control plane nodes are powered off or are unable to connect to each other via the network. Check that all control plane nodes are powered on and that network connections between each machine are functional.
annotations.summary: etcd is reporting that a majority of instances are unavailable.

annotations.message: ArgoCD application {{ $labels.name }} is out of sync
ArgoCD application console is out of sync

Image Registry Storage configuration has changed in the last 30
minutes. This change may have caused data loss.
HAProxy metrics are reporting that HAProxy is down on pod {{ $labels.namespace }} / {{ $labels.pod }}
HAProxy reloads are failing on {{ $labels.pod }}. Router is not respecting recently created or modified routes

The {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.name }} ingresscontroller is
degraded: {{ $labels.reason }}.

The {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.name }} ingresscontroller is
unavailable: {{ $labels.reason }}.

rules.name: APIRemovedInNextEUSReleaseInUse
rules.query: group by(group, version, resource) (apiserver_requested_deprecated_apis{removed_release=~"1\\.2[123]"}) and (sum by(group, version, resource) (rate(apiserver_request_total{system_client!="cluster-policy-controller",system_client!="kube-controller-manager"}[4h]))) > 0

annotations.message: Deprecated API that will be removed in the next EUS version is being used. Removing the workload that is using the {{ $labels.group }}.{{ $labels.version }}/{{ $labels.resource }} API might be necessary for a successful upgrade to the next EUS cluster version. Refer to `oc get apirequestcounts {{ $labels.resource }}.{{ $labels.version }}.{{ $labels.group }} -o yaml` to identify the workload.

rules.name: APIRemovedInNextReleaseInUse
rules.query: group by(group, version, resource) (apiserver_requested_deprecated_apis{removed_release="1.23"}) and (sum by(group, version, resource) (rate(apiserver_request_total{system_client!="cluster-policy-controller",system_client!="kube-controller-manager"}[4h]))) > 0

annotations.message: Deprecated API that will be removed in the next version is being used. Removing the workload that is using the {{ $labels.group }}.{{ $labels.version }}/{{ $labels.resource }} API might be necessary for a successful upgrade to the next cluster version. Refer to `oc get apirequestcounts {{ $labels.resource }}.{{ $labels.version }}.{{ $labels.group }} -o yaml` to identify the workload.

rules.name: AuditLogError
rules.query: sum by(apiserver, instance) (rate(apiserver_audit_error_total{apiserver=~".+-apiserver"}[5m])) / sum by(apiserver, instance) (rate(apiserver_audit_event_total{apiserver=~".+-apiserver"}[5m])) > 0

annotations.description: An API Server had an error writing to an audit log.
annotations.summary:
An API Server instance was unable to write audit logs. This could be
triggered by the node running out of space, or a malicious actor
tampering with the audit logs.

annotations.message: Extreme CPU pressure can cause slow serialization and poor performance from the kube-apiserver and etcd. When this happens, there is a risk of clients seeing non-responsive API requests which are issued again causing even more CPU pressure. It can also cause failing liveness probes due to slow etcd responsiveness on the backend. If one kube-apiserver fails under this condition, chances are you will experience a cascade as the remaining kube-apiservers are also under-provisioned. To fix this, increase the CPU and memory on your control plane nodes.
annotations.summary: CPU utilization on a single control plane node is very high, more CPU pressure is likely to cause a failover; increase available CPU.

annotations.message: Given three control plane nodes, the overall CPU utilization may only be about 2/3 of all available capacity. This is because if a single control plane node fails, the remaining two must handle the load of the cluster in order to be HA. If the cluster is using more than 2/3 of all capacity, if one control plane node fails, the remaining two are likely to fail when they take the load. To fix this, increase the CPU and memory on your control plane nodes.
annotations.summary: CPU utilization across all three control plane nodes is higher than two control plane nodes can sustain; a single control plane node outage may cause a cascading failure; increase available CPU.

annotations.description: The API server is burning too much error budget. This alert fires when too many requests are failing with high latency. Use the 'API Performance' monitoring dashboards to narrow down the request states and latency. The 'etcd' monitoring dashboards also provides metrics to help determine etcd stability and performance.
annotations.summary: The API server is burning too much error budget.

annotations.description: The API server is burning too much error budget. This alert fires when too many requests are failing with high latency. Use the 'API Performance' monitoring dashboards to narrow down the request states and latency. The 'etcd' monitoring dashboards also provides metrics to help determine etcd stability and performance.
annotations.summary: The API server is burning too much error budget.

annotations.message: Cluster has enabled tech preview features that will prevent upgrades.
KubeControllerManager has disappeared from Prometheus target discovery.
The pod disruption budget is preventing further disruption to pods because it is at the minimum allowed level.
The pod disruption budget is below the minimum number allowed pods.
KubeScheduler has disappeared from Prometheus target discovery.
The scheduler is currently configured to use a legacy scheduler policy API. Use of the policy API is deprecated and removed in 4.10.
machine api operator metrics collection is failing. For more details:  oc logs <machine-api-operator-pod-name> -n openshift-machine-api
machine {{ $labels.name }} has been in Deleting phase for more than 6 hours
machine {{ $labels.name }} is in phase: {{ $labels.phase }}
machine {{ $labels.name }} does not have valid node reference

rules.name: MasterNodesHighMemoryUsage
rules.query: ((sum(node_memory_MemTotal_bytes and on(instance) label_replace(kube_node_role{role="master"}, "instance", "$1", "node", "(.+)")) - sum(node_memory_MemFree_bytes + node_memory_Buffers_bytes + node_memory_Cached_bytes and on(instance) label_replace(kube_node_role{role="master"}, "instance", "$1", "node", "(.+)"))) / sum(node_memory_MemTotal_bytes and on(instance) label_replace(kube_node_role{role="master"}, "instance", "$1", "node", "(.+)")) * 100) > 90

annotations.message: Memory usage of {{ $value | humanize }} on {{ $labels.node }} exceeds 90%. Master nodes starved of memory could result in degraded performance of the control plane.
Drain failed on {{ $labels.node }} , updates may be blocked. For more details:  oc logs -f -n {{ $labels.namespace }} {{ $labels.pod }} -c machine-config-daemon
Kubelet health failure threshold reached
Error detected in pivot logs on {{ $labels.node }}
Reboot failed on {{ $labels.node }} , update may be blocked

System memory usage of {{ $value | humanize }} on {{ $labels.node }} exceeds 95% of the reservation. Reserved memory ensures system processes can function even when the node is fully allocated and protects against workload out of memory events impacting the proper functioning of the node. The default reservation is expected to be sufficient for most configurations and should be increased (https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/latest/nodes/nodes/nodes-nodes-managing.html) when running nodes with high numbers of pods (either due to rate of change or at steady state).
Default OperatorHub source "certified-operators" is in Non-Ready state for more than 10 mins.
Default OperatorHub source "community-operators" is in Non-Ready state for more than 10 mins.
Default OperatorHub source "redhat-marketplace" is in Non-Ready state for more than 10 mins.
Default OperatorHub source "redhat-operators" is in Non-Ready state for more than 10 mins.

annotations.description: {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} of Alertmanager instances within the {{$labels.job}} cluster have been up for less than half of the last 5m.
annotations.summary: Half or more of the Alertmanager instances within the same cluster are down.

annotations.description: The minimum notification failure rate to {{ $labels.integration }} sent from any instance in the {{$labels.job}} cluster is {{ $value | humanizePercentage }}.
annotations.summary: All Alertmanager instances in a cluster failed to send notifications to a non-critical integration.

annotations.description: The minimum notification failure rate to {{ $labels.integration }} sent from any instance in the {{$labels.job}} cluster is {{ $value | humanizePercentage }}.
annotations.summary: All Alertmanager instances in a cluster failed to send notifications to a critical integration.

annotations.description: Alertmanager instances within the {{$labels.job}} cluster have different configurations.
annotations.summary: Alertmanager instances within the same cluster have different configurations.

annotations.description: Configuration has failed to load for {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.pod}}.
annotations.summary: Reloading an Alertmanager configuration has failed.

annotations.description: Alertmanager {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.pod}} failed to send {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} of notifications to {{ $labels.integration }}.
annotations.summary: An Alertmanager instance failed to send notifications.

rules.name: AlertmanagerMembersInconsistent
rules.query: max_over_time(alertmanager_cluster_members{job="alertmanager-main",namespace="openshift-monitoring"}[5m]) < on(namespace, service) group_left() count by(namespace, service) (max_over_time(alertmanager_cluster_members{job="alertmanager-main",namespace="openshift-monitoring"}[5m]))

annotations.description: Alertmanager {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.pod}} has only found {{ $value }} members of the {{$labels.job}} cluster.
annotations.summary: A member of an Alertmanager cluster has not found all other cluster members.

annotations.description:
This is an alert meant to ensure that the entire alerting pipeline is functional.
This alert is always firing, therefore it should always be firing in Alertmanager
and always fire against a receiver. There are integrations with various notification
mechanisms that send a notification when this alert is not firing. For example the
"DeadMansSnitch" integration in PagerDuty.
annotations.summary: An alert that should always be firing to certify that Alertmanager is working properly.

annotations.description:
This is an alert meant to ensure that the entire alerting pipeline is functional.
This alert is always firing, therefore it should always be firing in Alertmanager
and always fire against a receiver. There are integrations with various notification
mechanisms that send a notification when this alert is not firing. For example the
"DeadMansSnitch" integration in PagerDuty.
annotations.summary: An alert that should always be firing to certify that Alertmanager is working properly.

annotations.description: Network interface "{{ $labels.device }}" changing its up status often on node-exporter {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.pod }}
annotations.summary: Network interface is often changing its status

rules.name: HighlyAvailableWorkloadIncorrectlySpread
rules.query: count without(node) (group by(node, workload, namespace) (kube_pod_info{node!=""} * on(namespace, pod) group_left(workload) (max by(namespace, pod, workload) (kube_pod_spec_volumes_persistentvolumeclaims_info) * on(namespace, pod) group_left(workload) (namespace_workload_pod:kube_pod_owner:relabel * on(namespace, workload, workload_type) group_left() (count without(pod) (namespace_workload_pod:kube_pod_owner:relabel{namespace=~"(openshift-.*|kube-.*|default)"}) > 1))))) == 1

annotations.description: Workload {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.workload }} is incorrectly spread across multiple nodes which breaks high-availability requirements. Since the workload is using persistent volumes, manual intervention is needed. Please follow the guidelines provided in the runbook of this alert to fix this issue.
annotations.summary: Highly-available workload is incorrectly spread across multiple nodes and manual intervention is needed.

rules.name: TargetDown
rules.query: 100 * (count by(job, namespace, service) (up == 0 unless on(node) max by(node) (kube_node_spec_unschedulable == 1)) / count by(job, namespace, service) (up unless on(node) max by(node) (kube_node_spec_unschedulable == 1))) > 10

annotations.description: {{ printf "%.4g" $value }}% of the {{ $labels.job }}/{{ $labels.service }} targets in {{ $labels.namespace }} namespace have been unreachable for more than 15 minutes. This may be a symptom of network connectivity issues, down nodes, or failures within these components. Assess the health of the infrastructure and nodes running these targets and then contact support.
annotations.summary: Some targets were not reachable from the monitoring server for an extended period of time.

rules.name: cluster:usage:openshift:ingress_request_error:fraction5m
rules.query: sum(max without(service, endpoint, container, pod, job, namespace) (increase(haproxy_server_http_responses_total{code!~"2xx|1xx|4xx|3xx",exported_namespace=~"openshift-.*"}[5m]) > 0)) / sum(max without(service, endpoint, container, pod, job, namespace) (increase(haproxy_server_http_responses_total{exported_namespace=~"openshift-.*"}[5m]))) or absent(__does_not_exist__) * 0

rules.name: cluster:usage:openshift:ingress_request_total:irate5m
rules.query: sum(max without(service, endpoint, container, pod, job, namespace) (irate(haproxy_server_http_responses_total{exported_namespace=~"openshift-.*"}[5m]))) or absent(__does_not_exist__) * 0

rules.name: cluster:usage:workload:ingress_request_error:fraction5m
rules.query: sum(max without(service, endpoint, container, pod, job, namespace) (increase(haproxy_server_http_responses_total{code!~"2xx|1xx|4xx|3xx",exported_namespace!~"openshift-.*"}[5m]) > 0)) / sum(max without(service, endpoint, container, pod, job, namespace) (increase(haproxy_server_http_responses_total{exported_namespace!~"openshift-.*"}[5m]))) or absent(__does_not_exist__) * 0

rules.name: cluster:usage:workload:ingress_request_total:irate5m
rules.query: sum(max without(service, endpoint, container, pod, job, namespace) (irate(haproxy_server_http_responses_total{exported_namespace!~"openshift-.*"}[5m]))) or absent(__does_not_exist__) * 0

annotations.description: Alerts are not configured to be sent to a notification system, meaning that you may not be notified in a timely fashion when important failures occur. Check the OpenShift documentation to learn how to configure notifications with Alertmanager.
annotations.summary: Receivers (notification integrations) are not configured on Alertmanager

annotations.description: Alerts are not configured to be sent to a notification system, meaning that you may not be notified in a timely fashion when important failures occur. Check the OpenShift documentation to learn how to configure notifications with Alertmanager.
annotations.summary: Receivers (notification integrations) are not configured on Alertmanager

annotations.description: Errors are occurring during reconciliation cycles. Inspect the cluster-monitoring-operator log for potential root causes.
annotations.summary: Cluster Monitoring Operator is experiencing unexpected reconciliation errors.

annotations.description: Deployment {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.deployment }} has not matched the expected number of replicas for longer than 15 minutes. This indicates that cluster infrastructure is unable to start or restart the necessary components. This most often occurs when one or more nodes are down or partioned from the cluster, or a fault occurs on the node that prevents the workload from starting. In rare cases this may indicate a new version of a cluster component cannot start due to a bug or configuration error. Assess the pods for this deployment to verify they are running on healthy nodes and then contact support.
annotations.summary: Deployment has not matched the expected number of replicas

rules.name: MultipleContainersOOMKilled
rules.query: sum(max by(namespace, container, pod) (increase(kube_pod_container_status_restarts_total[12m])) and max by(namespace, container, pod) (kube_pod_container_status_last_terminated_reason{reason="OOMKilled"}) == 1) > 5

annotations.description: Multiple containers were out of memory killed within the past 15 minutes. There are many potential causes of OOM errors, however issues on a specific node or containers breaching their limits is common.
annotations.summary: Containers are being killed due to OOM

rules.name: cluster:capacity_cpu_cores:sum
rules.query: sum by(label_beta_kubernetes_io_instance_type, label_node_role_kubernetes_io, label_kubernetes_io_arch, label_node_openshift_io_os_id) ((cluster:master_nodes * on(node) group_left() max by(node) (kube_node_status_capacity{resource="cpu",unit="core"})) or on(node) (max without(endpoint, instance, job, pod, service) (kube_node_labels) * on(node) group_left() max by(node) (kube_node_status_capacity{resource="cpu",unit="core"})))

rules.name: cluster:capacity_cpu_sockets_hyperthread_enabled:sum
rules.query: count by(label_beta_kubernetes_io_instance_type, label_node_hyperthread_enabled, label_node_role_kubernetes_io) (max by(node, package, label_beta_kubernetes_io_instance_type, label_node_hyperthread_enabled, label_node_role_kubernetes_io) (cluster:cpu_core_node_labels))

rules.name: cluster:capacity_memory_bytes:sum
rules.query: sum by(label_beta_kubernetes_io_instance_type, label_node_role_kubernetes_io) ((cluster:master_nodes * on(node) group_left() max by(node) (kube_node_status_capacity{resource="memory",unit="byte"})) or on(node) (max without(endpoint, instance, job, pod, service) (kube_node_labels) * on(node) group_left() max by(node) (kube_node_status_capacity{resource="memory",unit="byte"})))

rules.name: cluster:control_plane:all_nodes_ready
rules.query: sum(min by(node) (kube_node_status_condition{condition="Ready",status="true"}) and max by(node) (kube_node_role{role="master"})) == bool sum(kube_node_role{role="master"})

rules.name: cluster:cpu_core_hyperthreading
rules.query: clamp_max(label_replace(sum by(instance, package, core) (node_cpu_info{core!="",package!=""} or label_replace(label_join(node_cpu_info{core="",package=""}, "core", "", "cpu"), "package", "0", "package", "")) > 1, "label_node_hyperthread_enabled", "true", "instance", "(.*)") or on(instance, package) label_replace(sum by(instance, package, core) (label_replace(node_cpu_info{core!="",package!=""} or label_join(node_cpu_info{core="",package=""}, "core", "", "cpu"), "package", "0", "package", "")) <= 1, "label_node_hyperthread_enabled", "false", "instance", "(.*)"), 1)

rules.name: cluster:cpu_core_node_labels
rules.query: topk by(node) (1, cluster:nodes_roles) * on(node) group_right(label_beta_kubernetes_io_instance_type, label_node_role_kubernetes_io, label_node_openshift_io_os_id, label_kubernetes_io_arch, label_node_role_kubernetes_io_master, label_node_role_kubernetes_io_infra) label_replace(cluster:cpu_core_hyperthreading, "node", "$1", "instance", "(.*)")

rules.name: cluster:hyperthread_enabled_nodes
rules.query: kube_node_labels and on(node) (sum by(node, package, core) (label_replace(node_cpu_info, "node", "$1", "instance", "(.*)")) == 2)

rules.name: cluster:infra_nodes
rules.query: max without(endpoint, instance, job, pod, service) (kube_node_labels and on(node) kube_node_role{role="infra"})

rules.name: cluster:kube_persistentvolumeclaim_resource_requests_storage_bytes:provisioner:sum
rules.query: sum by(provisioner) (topk by(namespace, persistentvolumeclaim) (1, kube_persistentvolumeclaim_resource_requests_storage_bytes) * on(namespace, persistentvolumeclaim) group_right() topk by(namespace, persistentvolumeclaim) (1, kube_persistentvolumeclaim_info * on(storageclass) group_left(provisioner) topk by(storageclass) (1, max by(storageclass, provisioner) (kube_storageclass_info))))

rules.name: cluster:kubelet_volume_stats_used_bytes:provisioner:sum
rules.query: sum by(provisioner) (topk by(namespace, persistentvolumeclaim) (1, kubelet_volume_stats_used_bytes) * on(namespace, persistentvolumeclaim) group_right() topk by(namespace, persistentvolumeclaim) (1, kube_persistentvolumeclaim_info * on(storageclass) group_left(provisioner) topk by(storageclass) (1, max by(storageclass, provisioner) (kube_storageclass_info))))

rules.name: cluster:master_infra_nodes
rules.query: max without(endpoint, instance, job, pod, service) (cluster:master_nodes and on(node) cluster:infra_nodes)

rules.name: cluster:master_nodes
rules.query: max without(endpoint, instance, job, pod, service) (kube_node_labels and on(node) kube_node_role{role="master"})

rules.name: cluster:node_instance_type_count:sum
rules.query: sum by(label_beta_kubernetes_io_instance_type, label_node_role_kubernetes_io, label_kubernetes_io_arch, label_node_openshift_io_os_id) (cluster:master_nodes or on(node) kube_node_labels)

rules.name: cluster:nodes_roles
rules.query: cluster:master_infra_nodes or on(node) cluster:master_nodes or on(node) cluster:infra_nodes or on(node) max without(endpoint, instance, job, pod, service) (kube_node_labels)

rules.name: cluster:usage:kube_schedulable_node_ready_reachable:avg5m
rules.query: avg_over_time((((count((max by(node) (up{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics"} == 1) and max by(node) (kube_node_status_condition{condition="Ready",status="true"} == 1) and min by(node) (kube_node_spec_unschedulable == 0))) / scalar(count(min by(node) (kube_node_spec_unschedulable == 0))))))[5m:1s])

rules.name: cluster:virt_platform_nodes:sum
rules.query: count by(type, system_manufacturer, system_product_name, baseboard_manufacturer, baseboard_product_name) (sum by(instance, type, system_manufacturer, system_product_name, baseboard_manufacturer, baseboard_product_name) (virt_platform))

rules.name: kube_running_pod_ready
rules.query: (max without(condition, container, endpoint, instance, job, service) (((kube_pod_status_ready{condition="false"} == 1) * 0 or (kube_pod_status_ready{condition="true"} == 1)) * on(pod, namespace) group_left() group by(pod, namespace) (kube_pod_status_phase{phase=~"Running|Unknown|Pending"} == 1)))

rules.name: node_role_os_version_machine:cpu_capacity_cores:sum
rules.query: count by(label_kubernetes_io_arch, label_node_hyperthread_enabled, label_node_openshift_io_os_id, label_node_role_kubernetes_io_master, label_node_role_kubernetes_io_infra) (cluster:cpu_core_node_labels)

rules.name: node_role_os_version_machine:cpu_capacity_sockets:sum
rules.query: count by(label_kubernetes_io_arch, label_node_hyperthread_enabled, label_node_openshift_io_os_id, label_node_role_kubernetes_io_master, label_node_role_kubernetes_io_infra) (max by(node, package, label_kubernetes_io_arch, label_node_hyperthread_enabled, label_node_openshift_io_os_id, label_node_role_kubernetes_io_master, label_node_role_kubernetes_io_infra) (cluster:cpu_core_node_labels))

rules.name: namespace_job:scrape_samples_post_metric_relabeling:topk3
rules.query: topk(3, max by(namespace, job) (topk by(namespace, job) (1, scrape_samples_post_metric_relabeling)))

rules.name: namespace_workload_pod:kube_pod_owner:relabel
rules.query: max by(cluster, namespace, workload, pod) (label_replace(label_replace(kube_pod_owner{job="kube-state-metrics",owner_kind="ReplicationController"}, "replicationcontroller", "$1", "owner_name", "(.*)") * on(replicationcontroller, namespace) group_left(owner_name) topk by(replicationcontroller, namespace) (1, max by(replicationcontroller, namespace, owner_name) (kube_replicationcontroller_owner{job="kube-state-metrics"})), "workload", "$1", "owner_name", "(.*)"))

annotations.description: kube-state-metrics is experiencing errors at an elevated rate in list operations. This is likely causing it to not be able to expose metrics about Kubernetes objects correctly or at all.
annotations.summary: kube-state-metrics is experiencing errors in list operations.

annotations.description: kube-state-metrics is experiencing errors at an elevated rate in watch operations. This is likely causing it to not be able to expose metrics about Kubernetes objects correctly or at all.
annotations.summary: kube-state-metrics is experiencing errors in watch operations.

rules.name: cluster:namespace:pod_cpu:active:kube_pod_container_resource_limits
rules.query: kube_pod_container_resource_limits{job="kube-state-metrics",resource="cpu"} * on(namespace, pod, cluster) group_left() max by(namespace, pod) ((kube_pod_status_phase{phase=~"Pending|Running"} == 1))

rules.name: cluster:namespace:pod_cpu:active:kube_pod_container_resource_requests
rules.query: kube_pod_container_resource_requests{job="kube-state-metrics",resource="cpu"} * on(namespace, pod, cluster) group_left() max by(namespace, pod) ((kube_pod_status_phase{phase=~"Pending|Running"} == 1))

rules.name: cluster:namespace:pod_memory:active:kube_pod_container_resource_limits
rules.query: kube_pod_container_resource_limits{job="kube-state-metrics",resource="memory"} * on(namespace, pod, cluster) group_left() max by(namespace, pod) ((kube_pod_status_phase{phase=~"Pending|Running"} == 1))

rules.name: cluster:namespace:pod_memory:active:kube_pod_container_resource_requests
rules.query: kube_pod_container_resource_requests{job="kube-state-metrics",resource="memory"} * on(namespace, pod, cluster) group_left() max by(namespace, pod) ((kube_pod_status_phase{phase=~"Pending|Running"} == 1))

rules.name: namespace_cpu:kube_pod_container_resource_limits:sum
rules.query: sum by(namespace, cluster) (sum by(namespace, pod, cluster) (max by(namespace, pod, container, cluster) (kube_pod_container_resource_limits{job="kube-state-metrics",resource="cpu"}) * on(namespace, pod, cluster) group_left() max by(namespace, pod, cluster) (kube_pod_status_phase{phase=~"Pending|Running"} == 1)))

rules.name: namespace_cpu:kube_pod_container_resource_requests:sum
rules.query: sum by(namespace, cluster) (sum by(namespace, pod, cluster) (max by(namespace, pod, container, cluster) (kube_pod_container_resource_requests{job="kube-state-metrics",resource="cpu"}) * on(namespace, pod, cluster) group_left() max by(namespace, pod, cluster) (kube_pod_status_phase{phase=~"Pending|Running"} == 1)))

rules.name: namespace_memory:kube_pod_container_resource_limits:sum
rules.query: sum by(namespace, cluster) (sum by(namespace, pod, cluster) (max by(namespace, pod, container, cluster) (kube_pod_container_resource_limits{job="kube-state-metrics",resource="memory"}) * on(namespace, pod, cluster) group_left() max by(namespace, pod, cluster) (kube_pod_status_phase{phase=~"Pending|Running"} == 1)))

rules.name: namespace_memory:kube_pod_container_resource_requests:sum
rules.query: sum by(namespace, cluster) (sum by(namespace, pod, cluster) (max by(namespace, pod, container, cluster) (kube_pod_container_resource_requests{job="kube-state-metrics",resource="memory"}) * on(namespace, pod, cluster) group_left() max by(namespace, pod, cluster) (kube_pod_status_phase{phase=~"Pending|Running"} == 1)))

rules.name: namespace_workload_pod:kube_pod_owner:relabel
rules.query: max by(cluster, namespace, workload, pod) (label_replace(label_replace(kube_pod_owner{job="kube-state-metrics",owner_kind="ReplicaSet"}, "replicaset", "$1", "owner_name", "(.*)") * on(replicaset, namespace) group_left(owner_name) topk by(replicaset, namespace) (1, max by(replicaset, namespace, owner_name) (kube_replicaset_owner{job="kube-state-metrics"})), "workload", "$1", "owner_name", "(.*)"))

rules.name: node_namespace_pod_container:container_cpu_usage_seconds_total:sum_irate
rules.query: sum by(cluster, namespace, pod, container) (irate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{image!="",job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics/cadvisor"}[5m])) * on(cluster, namespace, pod) group_left(node) topk by(cluster, namespace, pod) (1, max by(cluster, namespace, pod, node) (kube_pod_info{node!=""}))

rules.name: node_namespace_pod_container:container_memory_cache
rules.query: container_memory_cache{image!="",job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics/cadvisor"} * on(namespace, pod) group_left(node) topk by(namespace, pod) (1, max by(namespace, pod, node) (kube_pod_info{node!=""}))

rules.name: node_namespace_pod_container:container_memory_rss
rules.query: container_memory_rss{image!="",job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics/cadvisor"} * on(namespace, pod) group_left(node) topk by(namespace, pod) (1, max by(namespace, pod, node) (kube_pod_info{node!=""}))

rules.name: node_namespace_pod_container:container_memory_swap
rules.query: container_memory_swap{image!="",job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics/cadvisor"} * on(namespace, pod) group_left(node) topk by(namespace, pod) (1, max by(namespace, pod, node) (kube_pod_info{node!=""}))

rules.name: node_namespace_pod_container:container_memory_working_set_bytes
rules.query: container_memory_working_set_bytes{image!="",job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics/cadvisor"} * on(namespace, pod) group_left(node) topk by(namespace, pod) (1, max by(namespace, pod, node) (kube_pod_info{node!=""}))

rules.name: node_quantile:kubelet_pleg_relist_duration_seconds:histogram_quantile
rules.query: histogram_quantile(0.5, sum by(instance, le) (rate(kubelet_pleg_relist_duration_seconds_bucket[5m])) * on(instance) group_left(node) kubelet_node_name{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics"})

rules.name: node_quantile:kubelet_pleg_relist_duration_seconds:histogram_quantile
rules.query: histogram_quantile(0.9, sum by(instance, le) (rate(kubelet_pleg_relist_duration_seconds_bucket[5m])) * on(instance) group_left(node) kubelet_node_name{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics"})

rules.name: node_quantile:kubelet_pleg_relist_duration_seconds:histogram_quantile
rules.query: histogram_quantile(0.99, sum by(instance, le) (rate(kubelet_pleg_relist_duration_seconds_bucket[5m])) * on(instance) group_left(node) kubelet_node_name{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics"})

annotations.description: Pod {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.pod }} container {{ $labels.container}} has been in waiting state for longer than 1 hour.
annotations.summary: Pod container waiting longer than 1 hour

annotations.description: {{ $value }} Pods of DaemonSet {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.daemonset }} are running where they are not supposed to run.
annotations.summary: DaemonSet pods are misscheduled.

annotations.description: {{ $value }} Pods of DaemonSet {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.daemonset }} are not scheduled.
annotations.summary: DaemonSet pods are not scheduled.

annotations.description: DaemonSet {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.daemonset }} has not finished or progressed for at least 30 minutes.
annotations.summary: DaemonSet rollout is stuck.

annotations.description: Deployment generation for {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.deployment }} does not match, this indicates that the Deployment has failed but has not been rolled back.
annotations.summary: Deployment generation mismatch due to possible roll-back

annotations.description: HPA {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.horizontalpodautoscaler  }} has been running at max replicas for longer than 15 minutes.
annotations.summary: HPA is running at max replicas

annotations.description: HPA {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.horizontalpodautoscaler  }} has not matched the desired number of replicas for longer than 15 minutes.
annotations.summary: HPA has not matched descired number of replicas.

annotations.description: Job {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.job_name }} is taking more than 12 hours to complete.
annotations.summary: Job did not complete in time

annotations.description: Job {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.job_name }} failed to complete. Removing failed job after investigation should clear this alert.
annotations.summary: Job failed to complete.

annotations.description: Pod {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.pod }} ({{ $labels.container }}) is in waiting state (reason: "CrashLoopBackOff").
annotations.summary: Pod is crash looping.

rules.name: KubePodNotReady
rules.query: sum by(namespace, pod) (max by(namespace, pod) (kube_pod_status_phase{job="kube-state-metrics",namespace=~"(openshift-.*|kube-.*|default)",phase=~"Pending|Unknown"}) * on(namespace, pod) group_left(owner_kind) topk by(namespace, pod) (1, max by(namespace, pod, owner_kind) (kube_pod_owner{owner_kind!="Job"}))) > 0

annotations.description: Pod {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.pod }} has been in a non-ready state for longer than 15 minutes.
annotations.summary: Pod has been in a non-ready state for more than 15 minutes.

annotations.description: StatefulSet generation for {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.statefulset }} does not match, this indicates that the StatefulSet has failed but has not been rolled back.
annotations.summary: StatefulSet generation mismatch due to possible roll-back

annotations.description: StatefulSet {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.statefulset }} has not matched the expected number of replicas for longer than 15 minutes.
annotations.summary: Deployment has not matched the expected number of replicas.

annotations.description: StatefulSet {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.statefulset }} update has not been rolled out.
annotations.summary: StatefulSet update has not been rolled out.

annotations.description: Cluster has overcommitted CPU resource requests for Pods by {{ $value }} CPU shares and cannot tolerate node failure.
annotations.summary: Cluster has overcommitted CPU resource requests.

annotations.description: Cluster has overcommitted CPU resource requests for Pods by 0.19799999999999685 CPU shares and cannot tolerate node failure.
annotations.summary: Cluster has overcommitted CPU resource requests.

annotations.description: Cluster has overcommitted CPU resource requests for Namespaces.
annotations.summary: Cluster has overcommitted CPU resource requests.

annotations.description: Cluster has overcommitted memory resource requests for Pods by {{ $value }} bytes and cannot tolerate node failure.
annotations.summary: Cluster has overcommitted memory resource requests.

annotations.description: Cluster has overcommitted memory resource requests for Namespaces.
annotations.summary: Cluster has overcommitted memory resource requests.

annotations.description: Namespace {{ $labels.namespace }} is using {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} of its {{ $labels.resource }} quota.
annotations.summary: Namespace quota is going to be full.

annotations.description: Namespace {{ $labels.namespace }} is using {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} of its {{ $labels.resource }} quota.
annotations.summary: Namespace quota has exceeded the limits.

annotations.description: Namespace {{ $labels.namespace }} is using {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} of its {{ $labels.resource }} quota.
annotations.summary: Namespace quota is fully used.

annotations.description: The persistent volume {{ $labels.persistentvolume }} has status {{ $labels.phase }}.
annotations.summary: PersistentVolume is having issues with provisioning.

annotations.description: The PersistentVolume claimed by {{ $labels.persistentvolumeclaim }} in Namespace {{ $labels.namespace }} is only {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} free.
annotations.summary: PersistentVolume is filling up.

annotations.description: Based on recent sampling, the PersistentVolume claimed by {{ $labels.persistentvolumeclaim }} in Namespace {{ $labels.namespace }} is expected to fill up within four days. Currently {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} is available.
annotations.summary: PersistentVolume is filling up.

rules.name: KubeClientErrors
rules.query: (sum by(instance, job, namespace) (rate(rest_client_requests_total{code=~"5.."}[5m])) / sum by(instance, job, namespace) (rate(rest_client_requests_total[5m]))) > 0.01

annotations.description: Kubernetes API server client '{{ $labels.job }}/{{ $labels.instance }}' is experiencing {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} errors.'
annotations.summary: Kubernetes API server client is experiencing errors.

annotations.description: An aggregated API {{ $labels.name }}/{{ $labels.namespace }} has been only {{ $value | humanize }}% available over the last 10m.
annotations.summary: An aggregated API is down.

annotations.description: An aggregated API {{ $labels.name }}/{{ $labels.namespace }} has reported errors. It has appeared unavailable {{ $value | humanize }} times averaged over the past 10m.
annotations.summary: An aggregated API has reported errors.

annotations.description: KubeAPI has disappeared from Prometheus target discovery.
annotations.summary: Target disappeared from Prometheus target discovery.

annotations.description: The apiserver has terminated {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} of its incoming requests.
annotations.summary: The apiserver has terminated {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} of its incoming requests.

annotations.description: {{ $labels.node }} has been unready for more than 15 minutes.
annotations.summary: Node is not ready.

annotations.description: The readiness status of node {{ $labels.node }} has changed {{ $value }} times in the last 15 minutes.
annotations.summary: Node readiness status is flapping.

annotations.description: {{ $labels.node }} is unreachable and some workloads may be rescheduled.
annotations.summary: Node is unreachable.

annotations.description: Kubelet on node {{ $labels.node }} has failed to renew its client certificate ({{ $value | humanize }} errors in the last 5 minutes).
annotations.summary: Kubelet has failed to renew its client certificate.

annotations.description: Kubelet has disappeared from Prometheus target discovery.
annotations.summary: Target disappeared from Prometheus target discovery.

annotations.description: The Kubelet Pod Lifecycle Event Generator has a 99th percentile duration of {{ $value }} seconds on node {{ $labels.node }}.
annotations.summary: Kubelet Pod Lifecycle Event Generator is taking too long to relist.

rules.name: KubeletPodStartUpLatencyHigh
rules.query: histogram_quantile(0.99, sum by(instance, le) (rate(kubelet_pod_worker_duration_seconds_bucket{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics"}[5m]))) * on(instance) group_left(node) kubelet_node_name{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics"} > 60

annotations.description: Kubelet Pod startup 99th percentile latency is {{ $value }} seconds on node {{ $labels.node }}.
annotations.summary: Kubelet Pod startup latency is too high.

annotations.description: Kubelet on node {{ $labels.node }} has failed to renew its server certificate ({{ $value | humanize }} errors in the last 5 minutes).
annotations.summary: Kubelet has failed to renew its server certificate.

rules.name: KubeletTooManyPods
rules.query: count by(node) ((kube_pod_status_phase{job="kube-state-metrics",phase="Running"} == 1) * on(instance, pod, namespace, cluster) group_left(node) topk by(instance, pod, namespace, cluster) (1, kube_pod_info{job="kube-state-metrics"})) / max by(node) (kube_node_status_capacity{job="kube-state-metrics",resource="pods"} != 1) > 0.95

annotations.description: Kubelet '{{ $labels.node }}' is running at {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} of its Pod capacity.
annotations.summary: Kubelet is running at capacity.

rules.name: node_namespace_pod:kube_pod_info:
rules.query: topk by(namespace, pod) (1, max by(node, namespace, pod) (label_replace(kube_pod_info{job="kube-state-metrics",node!=""}, "pod", "$1", "pod", "(.*)")))

annotations.description: Clock on {{ $labels.instance }} is not synchronising. Ensure NTP is configured on this host.
annotations.summary: Clock not synchronising.

annotations.description: Clock on {{ $labels.instance }} is out of sync by more than 300s. Ensure NTP is configured correctly on this host.
annotations.summary: Clock skew detected.

annotations.description: File descriptors limit at {{ $labels.instance }} is currently at {{ printf "%.2f" $value }}%.
annotations.summary: Kernel is predicted to exhaust file descriptors limit soon.

annotations.description: File descriptors limit at {{ $labels.instance }} is currently at {{ printf "%.2f" $value }}%.
annotations.summary: Kernel is predicted to exhaust file descriptors limit soon.

annotations.description: Filesystem on {{ $labels.device }} at {{ $labels.instance }} has only {{ printf "%.2f" $value }}% available inodes left.
annotations.summary: Filesystem has less than 3% inodes left.

annotations.description: Filesystem on {{ $labels.device }} at {{ $labels.instance }} has only {{ printf "%.2f" $value }}% available inodes left.
annotations.summary: Filesystem has less than 5% inodes left.

annotations.description: Filesystem on {{ $labels.device }} at {{ $labels.instance }} has only {{ printf "%.2f" $value }}% available space left.
annotations.summary: Filesystem has less than 3% space left.

annotations.description: Filesystem on {{ $labels.device }} at {{ $labels.instance }} has only {{ printf "%.2f" $value }}% available space left.
annotations.summary: Filesystem has less than 5% space left.

annotations.description: Filesystem on {{ $labels.device }} at {{ $labels.instance }} has only {{ printf "%.2f" $value }}% available inodes left and is filling up fast.
annotations.summary: Filesystem is predicted to run out of inodes within the next 4 hours.

annotations.description: Filesystem on {{ $labels.device }} at {{ $labels.instance }} has only {{ printf "%.2f" $value }}% available inodes left and is filling up.
annotations.summary: Filesystem is predicted to run out of inodes within the next 24 hours.

annotations.description: Filesystem on {{ $labels.device }} at {{ $labels.instance }} has only {{ printf "%.2f" $value }}% available space left and is filling up fast.
annotations.summary: Filesystem is predicted to run out of space within the next 4 hours.

annotations.description: Filesystem on {{ $labels.device }} at {{ $labels.instance }} has only {{ printf "%.2f" $value }}% available space left and is filling up.
annotations.summary: Filesystem is predicted to run out of space within the next 24 hours.

annotations.description: {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} of conntrack entries are used.
annotations.summary: Number of conntrack are getting close to the limit.

annotations.description: {{ $labels.instance }} interface {{ $labels.device }} has encountered {{ printf "%.0f" $value }} receive errors in the last two minutes.
annotations.summary: Network interface is reporting many receive errors.

annotations.description: {{ $labels.instance }} interface {{ $labels.device }} has encountered {{ printf "%.0f" $value }} transmit errors in the last two minutes.
annotations.summary: Network interface is reporting many transmit errors.

annotations.description: RAID array '{{ $labels.device }}' on {{ $labels.instance }} is in degraded state due to one or more disks failures. Number of spare drives is insufficient to fix issue automatically.
annotations.summary: RAID Array is degraded

annotations.description: At least one device in RAID array on {{ $labels.instance }} failed. Array '{{ $labels.device }}' needs attention and possibly a disk swap.
annotations.summary: Failed device in RAID array

annotations.description: Node Exporter text file collector failed to scrape.
annotations.summary: Node Exporter text file collector failed to scrape.

annotations.description: Prometheus {{$labels.namespace}}/{{$labels.pod}} has failed to reload its configuration.
annotations.summary: Failed Prometheus configuration reload.

annotations.description: Prometheus {{$labels.namespace}}/{{$labels.pod}} is dropping {{ printf "%.4g" $value  }} samples/s with different values but duplicated timestamp.
annotations.summary: Prometheus is dropping samples with duplicate timestamps.

annotations.description: {{ printf "%.1f" $value }}% errors while sending alerts from Prometheus {{$labels.namespace}}/{{$labels.pod}} to Alertmanager {{$labels.alertmanager}}.
annotations.summary: Prometheus has encountered more than 1% errors sending alerts to a specific Alertmanager.

annotations.description: Prometheus {{$labels.namespace}}/{{$labels.pod}} has dropped {{ printf "%.0f" $value }} targets because some samples exceeded the configured label_limit, label_name_length_limit or label_value_length_limit.
annotations.summary: Prometheus has dropped targets because some scrape configs have exceeded the labels limit.

annotations.description: Prometheus {{$labels.namespace}}/{{$labels.pod}} has missed {{ printf "%.0f" $value }} rule group evaluations in the last 5m.
annotations.summary: Prometheus is missing rule evaluations due to slow rule group evaluation.

annotations.description: Prometheus {{$labels.namespace}}/{{$labels.pod}} is not connected to any Alertmanagers.
annotations.summary: Prometheus is not connected to any Alertmanagers.

annotations.description: Prometheus {{$labels.namespace}}/{{$labels.pod}} is not ingesting samples.
annotations.summary: Prometheus is not ingesting samples.

annotations.description: Alert notification queue of Prometheus {{$labels.namespace}}/{{$labels.pod}} is running full.
annotations.summary: Prometheus alert notification queue predicted to run full in less than 30m.

annotations.description: Prometheus {{$labels.namespace}}/{{$labels.pod}} is dropping {{ printf "%.4g" $value  }} samples/s with timestamps arriving out of order.
annotations.summary: Prometheus drops samples with out-of-order timestamps.

annotations.description: Prometheus {{$labels.namespace}}/{{$labels.pod}} failed to send {{ printf "%.1f" $value }}% of the samples to {{ $labels.remote_name}}:{{ $labels.url }}
annotations.summary: Prometheus fails to send samples to remote storage.

annotations.description: Prometheus {{$labels.namespace}}/{{$labels.pod}} remote write is {{ printf "%.1f" $value }}s behind for {{ $labels.remote_name}}:{{ $labels.url }}.
annotations.summary: Prometheus remote write is behind.

annotations.description: Prometheus {{$labels.namespace}}/{{$labels.pod}} remote write desired shards calculation wants to run {{ $value }} shards for queue {{ $labels.remote_name}}:{{ $labels.url }}, which is more than the max of {{ printf `prometheus_remote_storage_shards_max{instance="%s",job=~"prometheus-k8s|prometheus-user-workload"}` $labels.instance | query | first | value }}.
annotations.summary: Prometheus remote write desired shards calculation wants to run more than configured max shards.

annotations.description: Prometheus {{$labels.namespace}}/{{$labels.pod}} has failed to evaluate {{ printf "%.0f" $value }} rules in the last 5m.
annotations.summary: Prometheus is failing rule evaluations.

annotations.description: Prometheus {{$labels.namespace}}/{{$labels.pod}} has detected {{$value | humanize}} compaction failures over the last 3h.
annotations.summary: Prometheus has issues compacting blocks.

annotations.description: Prometheus {{$labels.namespace}}/{{$labels.pod}} has detected {{$value | humanize}} reload failures over the last 3h.
annotations.summary: Prometheus has issues reloading blocks from disk.

annotations.description: Prometheus {{$labels.namespace}}/{{$labels.pod}} has dropped {{ printf "%.0f" $value }} targets because the number of targets exceeded the configured target_limit.
annotations.summary: Prometheus has dropped targets because some scrape configs have exceeded the targets limit.

annotations.description: {{ printf "%.0f" $value }} targets in Prometheus {{$labels.namespace}}/{{$labels.pod}} have failed to sync because invalid configuration was supplied.
annotations.summary: Prometheus has failed to sync targets.

annotations.description: Thanos Sidecar {{$labels.instance}} bucket operations are failing
annotations.summary: Thanos Sidecar bucket operations are failing

annotations.description: Thanos Sidecar {{$labels.instance}} cannot connect to Prometheus.
annotations.summary: Thanos Sidecar cannot connect to Prometheus

annotations.description: Thanos Sidecar {{$labels.instance}} is unhealthy for more than {{$value}} seconds.
annotations.summary: Thanos Sidecar is unhealthy.

annotations.description: Errors while performing List operations in controller {{$labels.controller}} in {{$labels.namespace}} namespace.
annotations.summary: Errors while performing list operations in controller.

annotations.description: Errors while reconciling Prometheus in {{ $labels.namespace }} Namespace.
annotations.summary: Errors while reconciling Prometheus.

annotations.description: Prometheus operator in {{ $labels.namespace }} namespace isn't ready to reconcile {{ $labels.controller }} resources.
annotations.summary: Prometheus operator not ready

annotations.description: {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} of reconciling operations failed for {{ $labels.controller }} controller in {{ $labels.namespace }} namespace.
annotations.summary: Errors while reconciling controller.

annotations.description: Prometheus operator in {{ $labels.namespace }} namespace rejected {{ printf "%0.0f" $value }} {{ $labels.controller }}/{{ $labels.resource }} resources.
annotations.summary: Resources rejected by Prometheus operator

annotations.description: Controller {{ $labels.controller }} in {{ $labels.namespace }} namespace fails to reconcile {{ $value }} objects.
annotations.summary: Last controller reconciliation failed

annotations.description: Errors while performing watch operations in controller {{$labels.controller}} in {{$labels.namespace}} namespace.
annotations.summary: Errors while performing watch operations in controller.

annotations.description: Thanos Query {{$labels.job}} is failing to send {{$value | humanize}}% of requests.
annotations.summary: Thanos Query is failing to send requests.

annotations.description: Thanos Query {{$labels.job}} is failing to handle {{$value | humanize}}% of requests.
annotations.summary: Thanos Query is failing to handle requests.

annotations.description: Thanos Query {{$labels.job}} have {{$value | humanize}}% of failing DNS queries for store endpoints.
annotations.summary: Thanos Query is having high number of DNS failures.

annotations.description: Thanos Query {{$labels.job}} is failing to handle {{$value | humanize}}% of "query" requests.
annotations.summary: Thanos Query is failing to handle requests.

annotations.description: Thanos Query {{$labels.job}} is failing to handle {{$value | humanize}}% of "query_range" requests.
annotations.summary: Thanos Query is failing to handle requests.

annotations.message: Failed to install Operator {{ $labels.name }} version {{ $labels.version }}. Reason-{{ $labels.reason }}
Failed to install Operator grafana-operator.v4.1.1 version 4.1.1. Reason-NoOperatorGroup
Failed to install Operator {{ $labels.name }} version {{ $labels.version }}. Phase-{{ $labels.phase }} Reason-{{ $labels.reason }}

The API server returned a warning during installation or upgrade of an operator. An Event with reason "AppliedWithWarnings" has been created with complete details, including a reference to the InstallPlan step that generated the warning.

annotations.summary: The cluster is taking too long, on average, to apply kubernetes service rules to iptables.

rules.name: NodeProxyApplySlow
rules.query: histogram_quantile(0.95, kubeproxy_sync_proxy_rules_duration_seconds_bucket) * on(namespace, pod) group_right() topk by(namespace, pod) (1, kube_pod_info{namespace="openshift-sdn",pod=~"sdn-[^-]*"}) > 15

annotations.summary: SDN pod {{ $labels.pod }} on node {{ $labels.node }} is taking too long, on average, to apply kubernetes service rules to iptables.

rules.name: NodeProxyApplyStale
rules.query: (kubeproxy_sync_proxy_rules_last_queued_timestamp_seconds - kubeproxy_sync_proxy_rules_last_timestamp_seconds) * on(namespace, pod) group_right() topk by(namespace, pod) (1, kube_pod_info{namespace="openshift-sdn",pod=~"sdn-[^-]*"}) > 30

annotations.summary: SDN pod {{ $labels.pod }} on node {{ $labels.node }} has stale kubernetes service rules in iptables.
All nodes should be running an sdn pod, {{ $labels.node }} is not.
SDN pod {{ $labels.pod }} on node {{ $labels.node }} is not ready.
